p:
The CMIP5-AMIP5 flux component bias on SST bias, Δ T, regression sensitivities are −4.8 ± 1.1 and −1.3 ± 0.4 Wm −2K −1 for the total turbulent and long-wave flux, respectively. The sensitivity of −1.3 ± 0.4 Wm −2K −1 for long-wave suggests that a large fraction of the Stefan’s Law estimated emitted long-wave ~ 4.8 Wm −2K −1 is re-emitted towards the surface. The turbulent flux sensitivity of −4.8 ± 1.1 is broadly consistent with observational estimates of its sensitivity for the Southern Ocean region derived from ERAI
35 of < 10 Wm −2K −1.
